keyPolicies.policyDescription: Ensure everyone has an input into the way services are delivered and can meet our Police, students reps and council officers.
Fight for our local resources and services despite the government cuts to ensure Greenbank residents get the best service that can be provided.
Improve our local environment and help provide access to outdoor space for gardening and food growing.
Work to sustain sustainable neighbourhoods and retail corridors where businesses can thrive and residents' quality of life is protected.

issues.environment: Improve our local environment and help provide access to outdoor space for gardening and food growing.

housing.content: Improve our local environment and help provide access to outdoor space for gardening and food growing.

leaflet.personalStatement: I have lived in Greenbank Ward for nearly 25 years. I live in Lancaster Avenue and raised my family here. My three children all attended local Wavertree and Calderstones Schools and I am a community governor of Greenbank Primary School. I work for the trade union congress helping employers and trade unions provide workplace learning opportunities for all staff.

politicalExperience.achievements: Chair the Council’s Neighbourhoods Select Committee and sit on the Merseyside Waste & Recycling Authority. Worked closely with colleagues, MP and city Mayor James Roberts to make a difference locally.

images.caption: Laura Robertson-Collins with local Labour team.
Laura Robertson-Collins as city councillor and Louise Ellman as Member of Parliament.
